org.waarp.common.filemonitor

Class FileMonitor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.waarp.common.filemonitor.FileMonitor

  • public class FileMonitor
extends Object
    This package would like to propose a JSE 6 compatible way to scan a directory for new, deleted and changed files, in order to allow some functions like pooling a directory before actions.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  FileMonitor.FileItem
      One element in the directory

      Used by Waarp Business information
      protected class  FileMonitor.FileMonitorTimerInformationTask
      Class to run Waarp Business information in fixed delay rather than after each check
      protected static class  FileMonitor.FileMonitorTimerTask
      Timer task
      static class  FileMonitor.Status

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileMonitor

        public FileMonitor(String name,
                   File statusFile,
                   File stopFile,
                   File directory,
                   FilesystemBasedDigest.DigestAlgo digest,
                   long elapseTime,
                   FileFilter filter,
                   boolean scanSubdir,
                   FileMonitorCommandRunnableFuture commandValidFile,
                   FileMonitorCommandRunnableFuture commandRemovedFile,
                   FileMonitorCommandRunnableFuture commandCheckIteration)
        Parameters:
        name - name of this daemon
        statusFile - the file where the current status is saved (current files)
        stopFile - the file when created (.exists()) will stop the daemon
        directory - the directory where files will be monitored
        digest - the digest to use (default if null is MD5)
        elapseTime - the time to wait in ms for between 2 checks (default is 1000ms, minimum is 100ms)
        filter - the filter to be applied on selected files (default is isFile())
        commandValidFile - the commandValidFile to run (may be null, which means poll() commandValidFile has to be used)
        commandRemovedFile - the commandRemovedFile to run (may be null)
        commandCheckIteration - the commandCheckIteration to run (may be null), runs after each check (elapseTime)

    • Method Detail

      • setNextDay

        protected final void setNextDay()

      • setCommandCheckIteration

        public final void setCommandCheckIteration(FileMonitorCommandRunnableFuture commandCheckIteration)
        Parameters:
        commandCheckIteration - the commandCheckIteration to run (may be null), runs after each check (elapseTime)

      • setCommandValidFileFactory

        public final void setCommandValidFileFactory(FileMonitorCommandFactory factory,
                                             int fixedPool)
        Parameters:
        factory - the factory to used instead of simple instance (enables parallelism)
        fixedPool - if > 0, set the number of parallel threads allowed

      • getElapseWaarpTime

        public final long getElapseWaarpTime()
        Returns:
        the elapseWaarpTime

      • setElapseWaarpTime

        public final void setElapseWaarpTime(long elapseWaarpTime)
        if set greater than 1000 ms, will be parallel, else will be sequential after each check and ignoring this timer
        Parameters:
        elapseWaarpTime - the elapseWaarpTime to set

      • isIgnoreAlreadyUsed

        public final boolean isIgnoreAlreadyUsed()
        Returns:
        True if Already used files will be ignored

      • setIgnoreAlreadyUsed

        public final void setIgnoreAlreadyUsed(boolean ignoreAlreadyUsed)
        Parameters:
        ignoreAlreadyUsed - if True, already used files will be ignored. Else if False, if an already used file is modified, then it will be reused.

      • setCheckDelay
